a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Energy intensity by sector, United States, 1990 to 2012
Energy intensity is measured as the quantity of energy needed to produce one unit of economic output. This is
measured in megajoules (MJ) per 2011 international-$. This corrects for inflation and cross-country differences in
Data source: World Bank, Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL)
